results.code:
135 
136 def _run_external(
137     cmd: list[str],
138     name: str,
139     pass_desc: str = "",
140     mode: str = "auto",
141 ) -> GateResult:
142     """Run external tools like ruff/mypy/pytest.
143 
144     Rules:
145     - If the tool is not found: SKIPPED with guidance.
146     - If it returns code 0: PASS.
147     - Else: FAIL with captured output.
148     """
149     try:
150         proc = subprocess.run(
151             cmd,
152             capture_output=True,
153             text=True,
154             check=False,
155         )
156     except FileNotFoundError:
157         result = GateResult(name=name, passed=False, mode=mode)
158         result.status = "SKIPPED"
159         result.info = "tool not installed"
160         result.details = (
161             f"{name}: SKIPPED because {cmd[0]!r} was not found on PATH.\n"
162             "What was attempted:\n"
163             f"- We tried to run {cmd!r}\n"
164             "Why it skipped:\n"
165             "- That tool is not installed in this environment.\n"
166             "How to enable:\n"
167             f"- Add {cmd[0]} to your dev requirements / venv.\n"
168         )
169         result.returncode = 0
170         result.stdout = None
171         result.stderr = None
172         return result
173 
174     out = (proc.stdout or "") + (proc.stderr or "")
175 
176     if proc.returncode == 0:
177         # add nicer PASS info
178         extra_info = pass_desc
179         if name.lower() == "tests":
180             # grab "23 passed" etc.
181             m = re.search(r"(\d+)\s+passed", out)
182             if m:
183                 extra_info = f"{m.group(1)} tests"
184 
185         result = GateResult(name=name, passed=True, mode=mode)
186         result.info = extra_info.strip()
187         result.details = out.strip()
188         result.returncode = proc.returncode
189         result.stdout = proc.stdout
190         result.stderr = proc.stderr
191         return result
192 
193     # non-zero exit - analyze the output for error details
194     errors, warnings, fixable = _analyze_output_for_counts(name, out)
195 
196     result = GateResult(
197         name=name,
198         passed=False,
199         errors=errors,
200         warnings=warnings,
201         fixable=fixable,
202         mode=mode,
203     )
204     result.info = "see details"
205     result.details = out.strip()
206     result.returncode = proc.returncode
207     result.stdout = proc.stdout
208     result.stderr = proc.stderr
209     return result
210

113 
114 def _run_external(
115     cmd: list[str],
116     name: str,
117     pass_desc: str = "",
118     mode: str = "auto",
119 ):
120     try:
121         proc = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, check=False)
122     except FileNotFoundError:
123         result = GateResult(name=name, passed=False, mode=mode)
124         result.status = "SKIPPED"
125         result.info = "tool not installed"
126         result.details = (
127             f"{name}: SKIPPED because {cmd[0]!r} was not found on PATH.\n"
128             "What was attempted:\n"
129             f"- We tried to run {cmd!r}\n"
130             "Why it skipped:\n"
131             "- That tool is not installed in this environment.\n"
132             "How to enable:\n"
133             f"- Add {cmd[0]} to your dev requirements / venv.\n"
134         )
135         result.returncode = 0
136         result.stdout = None
137         result.stderr = None
138         return result
139 
140     out = (proc.stdout or "") + (proc.stderr or "")
141 
142     if proc.returncode == 0:
143         extra_info = pass_desc
144         if name.lower() == "tests":
145             m = re.search(r"(\d+)\s+passed", out)
146             if m:
147                 extra_info = f"{m.group(1)} tests"
148 
149         result = GateResult(name=name, passed=True, mode=mode)
150         result.info = extra_info.strip()
151         result.details = out.strip()
152         result.returncode = proc.returncode
153         result.stdout = proc.stdout
154         result.stderr = proc.stderr
155         return result
156 
157     errors, warnings, fixable = _analyze_output_for_counts(name, out)
158 
159     result = GateResult(
160         name=name,
161         passed=False,
162         errors=errors,
163         warnings=warnings,
164         fixable=fixable,
165         mode=mode,
166     )
167     result.info = "see details"
168     result.details = out.strip()
169     result.returncode = proc.returncode
170     result.stdout = proc.stdout
171     result.stderr = proc.stderr
172     return result
173
